channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Jubilation sweeps global markets, Wall Street roars after interest rate relief
item.description: Lower interest rates help financial markets in two big ways.

item.title: A way to play the too-hot utilities trade now that rate cuts have begun
item.description: Mike Khouw breaks down a trade on a utilities ETF that offers some protection in case the run pauses.

item.title: Index of U.S. leading economic indicators drops for sixth straight month
Supply chain mystery surrounds how Hezbollah’s pagers and walkie-talkies were turned into miniature bombs
item.description: Three firms are implicated in the attacks crippling Hezbollah, but no one claims to have made the deadly devices themselves.

item.title: Tesla’s Chinese rival Nio cuts price for new Onvo-branded car
item.description: There's yet another Chinese electric car aiming to undercut Tesla, with a steeper discount.

item.title: U.S. existing-home sales fall to lowest level since 2023
How Tom Steyer of Galvanize Climate Solutions is funding technology to save the planet
item.description: The former presidential candidate says people 'running corporations, particularly public corporations' should not set the agenda for the U.S.

item.title: Biden’s student debt forgiveness plan to remain blocked, federal judge orders
item.description: U.S. District Judge Randal Hall extended a restraining order against the Biden administration's latest student debt forgiveness plan.

item.title: Why stocks need to hold these post-Fed gains or put the S&P 500 in peril
Ad exec listed his divorce on LinkedIn—he says it was the worst job he ever had
item.description: Karl Dunn says he was pulling 20-hour weeks on his divorce, while "still running a multimillion-dollar piece of global business.”

item.title: Trump Media shares slide with DJT sale restrictions set to lift
item.description: Donald Trump, the majority shareholder of Trump Media and the biggest name on Truth Social, said he has no plans to sell his DJT stock when the lockup...

item.title: Dow industrials and S&P 500 in record territory after Fed’s rate cut
Every single member of the board just resigned from DNA tester 23andMe
item.description: CEO Anne Wojcicki said the mass exodus left her "surprised and disappointed."

item.title: From mortgages to auto loans, experts weigh in on when — or if — to refinance as interest rates fall
item.description: The Federal Reserve just cut interest rates by a half point. That may open up some refinancing opportunities for borrowers, depending on the type of l...

item.title: Fed cut delays but doesn’t derail recession, says noted stock-market strategist
